Korean Beef Bowls

korean
beef

Ingredients

  • 1 pound ground beef
  • 2 tbsp brown sugar
  • 1/4 cup soy sauce
  • 1 tablespoon sesame oil
  • 3 cloves garlic, minced
  • 1 teaspoon ginger, grated
  • 2 cups cooked rice (white or brown)
  • 2 cups mixed vegetables (broccoli, carrots, bell peppers, etc.)
  • Sesame seeds and green onions for garnish

Procedure

  1. Cook rice according to package instructions. Set aside.
  2. Chop the vegetables into bite-sized pieces.
  3. In a large skillet over medium heat, brown the ground beef, breaking it apart with a spoon as it cooks.
  4. In a small bowl, whisk together brown sugar, soy sauce, sesame oil, minced garlic, and ginger.
  5. Once the beef is fully cooked, pour the sauce over it. Stir well to coat the beef in the flavorful sauce. Allow it to simmer for a few minutes until the sauce thickens.
  6. Add the chopped vegetables to the skillet. Cook until the vegetables are tender but still slightly crisp.
  7. Scoop a portion of rice into each bowl, top with the Korean beef and vegetable mixture.
  8. Garnish with sesame seeds and chopped green onions for extra flavor. Serve immediately.
